thread.title: Yaya Toure: Manchester City star included in Champions League squad along with new signing Gabriel Jesus
thread.title_full: Yaya Toure: Manchester City star included in Champions League squad along with new signing Gabriel Jesus

author: achapman
title: Yaya Toure: Manchester City star included in Champions League squad along with new signing Gabriel Jesus
text:
Toure on Tour Yaya Toure: Manchester City star included in Champions League squad along with new signing Gabriel Jesus 
Pep Guardiola adds duo to European quest in place of crocked Ilkay Gundogan and out-of-favour Kelechi Iheanacho By TONY LITTLE Comments YAYA TOURE’S form has been rewarded by a recall to Manchester City’s Champions League squad. 
The Ivory Coast midfielder, 33, can now feature against Monaco in the two-leg last-16 tie later this month. 
3 Yaya Toure has been included in Manchester City’s Champions League squad 
Boss Pep Guardiola was allowed to name 17 overseas players in his group stage squad but three can be switched for the subsequent knockout phase. Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester City news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Toure replaces crocked Ilkay Gundogan , while Brazilian wonderkid Gabriel Jesus is also added to the 21-man squad in place of Kelechi Iheanacho . 
Bacary Sagna’s appeal against a £40,000 FA fine for an Instagram post questioning referee Lee Mason’s impartiality has been rejected. Manchester City defender John Stones gets kicked in the head at West Ham Reuters Gabriel Jesus also slots straight in at the expense of Kelechi Iheanacho Related Stories Jesus doesn't scare serg Sergio Aguero is happy at Manchester City and will fight new Etihad hero Gabriel Jesus for a starting spot under Pep Guardiola City slickers Gabriel Jesus and jubilant Manchester City team-mates laugh and hug each other in training after returning from 4-0 drubbing of West Ham Bac to Square One Bacary Sagna loses appeal against £40,000 FA fine for' 10 against 12' Instagram post Moraes THE MERRIER Man City ready to axe flop keeper Claudio Bravo and replace him with Benfica's Ederson Moraes Reuters 3 Pep Guardiola will be hoping the new faces can boost City's chances in Europe 
The French defender, 32, posted a photo with the caption “10 against 12… but still fighting and winning as a team” after City’s 2-1 win over Burnley on January 2. 
The decision comes on the back of the FA deciding not to charge West Ham defender Aaron Cresswell after he appeared to punch Raheem Sterling during City’s 4-0 win in London on Wednesday night.
